column1: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!////We decided to go for the smaller tapas selections rather than ordering a massive pile of paella.  Our kind server was very patient with us during the ordering process
column2: and we did go with some of her advice.  Everything was tasty
column3: and to be honest I was surprised that we were filled up after "only" six tapas choices.  The citrus-cured salmon is a beautifully presented platter with cucumber
column6: and toast.  I really liked the creamy texture of the Iberico ham croquetas
column7: paired with a cup of sherry aioli for dipping.  We also enjoyed the garlic potato salad
column8: mushrooms stuffed with spinach and manchego cheese
column9: short rib with glazed carrots and mashed potatoes
column10: and the special of the day empanada.
